item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率微跌，30 年期平均利率降至 6.65
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率三周来首次下降。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US fell for the first time in three weeks.】

item.title: 巴黎机场运营商称昂贵机票将冲击需求
item.description: 巴黎主要机场的运营商预计，未来几年机票价格将上涨，以补偿昂贵的替代航空燃料的使用，从而影响到世界上最受欢迎的旅游目的地的旅游需求。【原文：The operator of the main Paris airports predicted an increase in air fares in coming years to compensate for the use of expensive alternative aviation fuel, weighing on travel demand into the world’s most popular tourist destination.】

item.title: 德国部长称特朗普关税不得削弱欧盟绿色目标
item.description: 即将离任的德国环境部长表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将对汽车进口征收 25% 的关税后，欧盟必须抵制为帮助汽车制造商而削弱气候目标的压力。【原文：The European Union must resist pressure to weaken climate targets in order to aid carmakers after US President Donald Trump said he would slap a 25% tariff on auto imports, Germany’s outgoing environment minister said.】

item.title: 需求放缓，意大利奢侈品供应商计划与债权人谈判
item.description: 随着高端商品消费的下降，奢侈品供应商 Altofare 集团正准备与债权人展开债务谈判。【原文：Luxury supplier Altofare Group is preparing to kick off debt talks with its creditors as spending on high-end goods declines.】

item.title: 特朗普计划如何利用 "二次关税 "惩罚委内瑞拉石油进口商
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将关税视为经济政策和外交的核心工具，并创造性地提出了如何征收进口税的建议。其中一个例子是他计划征收所谓的互惠关税，即针对每个贸易伙伴定制的新关税，目的是抵消其任何被认为使美国出口商处于不利地位的做法。另一个例子是：他威胁要对来自以下国家的进口商品征收所谓的二级关税【原文：Having embraced tariffs as a central tool of both economic policy and diplomacy, US President Donald Trump has been creative with his proposals on how to deploy the import taxes. One example is his plan to impose so-called reciprocal tariffs — new duties to be customized for each trading partner with the aim of offsetting any of its practices deemed to put American exporters at a disadvantage. Another example: he’s threatened to impose what he’s calling secondary tariffs on imports from countrie】

item.title: 匈牙利迫使机构投资者增加债券购买量
item.description: 在收益率上升增加了本已捉襟见肘的预算的融资成本之后，匈牙利公布了迫使机构投资者增加购买地方债券的新规定。【原文：Hungary unveiled new rules forcing institutional investors to boost local bond purchases after rising yields increased financing costs for an already stretched budget.】

item.title: 纳米比亚将在当地筹集资金偿还 7.5 亿美元欧洲债券
item.description: 纳米比亚财政部长埃丽卡-沙福达（Ericah Shafudah）在预算报告中表示，纳米比亚将在当地筹集资金，以偿还将于10月29日到期的7.5亿美元欧元债券。【原文：Namibia will raise funds locally to repay its $750 million eurobond that’s maturing on Oct. 29, Finance Minister Ericah Shafudah said in her budget speech.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称美国经济放缓但未预测衰退
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）认为，随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推进激进的关税政策，美国经济今年将进入低速增长阶段，但并没有看到经济衰退的曙光。【原文：The International Monetary Fund sees the US economy shifting into a lower gear this year as President Donald Trump pushes forward with aggressive tariffs but doesn’t see a recession on the horizon.】

item.title: 向石油区的 "无，宝贝，无 "问好
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 墨西哥在关税问题上寻求特朗普的 "优惠待遇
item.description: 墨西哥经济部长马塞洛-埃布拉德（Marcelo Ebrard）说，既然美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正在全球范围内推进关税，墨西哥至少可以确保其出口到美国的产品获得比其他国家更低的关税。【原文：Now that US President Donald Trump is moving ahead with tariffs worldwide, Mexico can at least ensure its exports to the US get a lower fee than others, Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard said.】

item.title: 法国太阳能行业组织称修订后的补贴削减仍会损害该行业
item.description: 法国的太阳能和可再生能源贸易游说团体表示，政府计划限制对家庭屋顶和车棚安装等中小型项目的补贴，这将损害就业，不管最近是否有修订。【原文：France’s solar and renewable trade lobbies said government plans to curb subsidies for small and medium-sized projects such as home-rooftop and carport installations will hurt jobs, regardless of recent revisions.】

item.title: 黎巴嫩任命前汇丰银行行长苏艾德为中央银行行长
item.description: 黎巴嫩选择卡里姆-苏艾德（Karim Souaid）担任央行行长，挑选一位私营部门金融专家来领导拖延已久的金融部门改革，启动经济复苏。【原文：Lebanon selected Karim Souaid as central bank governor, picking a private-sector finance specialist to lead a long-delayed overhaul of the financial sector and kickstart an economic recovery.】

item.title: 威尔捐赠 5000 万美元创建癌症研究中心
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.前花旗集团首席执行官桑迪-威尔（Sandy Weill）和他的妻子琼（Joan）将向四家研究机构的新合作项目捐赠 5000 万美元，该项目旨在改善一种癌症治疗方法。【原文：Former Citigroup Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sandy Weill and his wife, Joan, are donating $50 million to a new partnership among four research institutions that aims to improve a type of cancer treatment.】

item.title: 面临特朗普关税的汽车供应商为发行垃圾债券增添甜头
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普决定对进口到法国的汽车征收 25% 的关税后，法国汽车供应商 Forvia SE 不得不提高其首次发行的美元高收益债券的定价。【原文：French auto supplier Forvia SE is having to hike pricing on its debut US dollar high-yield bond following US President Donald Trump’s decision to slap 25% tariffs on auto imports to the country.】

item.title: 特朗普的美国证券交易委员会人选面临尖锐的利益冲突审查
item.description: 保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）选中的证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）领导人选，他与华尔街和数字资产公司的密切关系正面临着一场早期的政治考验。【原文：Paul Atkins, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission, is facing an early political test over his strong ties to Wall Street and digital-asset firms.】

item.title: 特朗普关税将重创斯洛伐克的汽车经济
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的汽车关税将给斯洛伐克带来沉重打击，该国依赖汽车的经济规模达 1400 亿美元，是最容易受到美国贸易战影响的欧盟成员国之一。【原文：President Donald Trump’s car tariffs will take a heavy toll on Slovakia, whose $140 billion auto-dependent economy makes it among the most vulnerable European Union member states to the US trade war.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称现在预测四月利率决定为时尚早
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，由于全球贸易摩擦和欧洲政府支出计划加剧了不确定性，现在说欧洲央行下个月应再次降息还是暂停降息还为时过早。【原文：It’s too early to say whether the European Central Bank should cut interest rates again next month or pause as global trade friction and government spending plans in Europe fuel uncertainty, Vice President Luis de Guindos said.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将于 2025 年在墨西哥投资 60 亿美元增设分店
item.description: 美国零售业巨头沃尔玛墨西哥公司（Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB）计划今年向墨西哥业务投资 60 亿美元，以增加更多分店。【原文：Wal-Mart de Mexico SAB, the local unit of the US retail giant, plans to invest $6 billion this year in its Mexico operations to add more locations.】

item.title: 收费匮乏的银行正在获得 380 亿美元的垃圾收购交易
item.description: 一连串大额债务销售显示，杠杆收购市场正在暂时恢复运转，这让投资银行家们在经历了交易低迷期后稍稍松了一口气。【原文：A spate of big-ticket debt sales show the leveraged buyout market is tentatively kicking back into gear, offering some relief to investment bankers after a moribund period for dealmaking.】

item.title: 德意志银行董事长称德国免费获得 1 万亿美元
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）董事长亚历山大-怀纳恩德茨（Alexander Wynaendts）表示，在债券市场对德国 "历史性 "支出法案作出积极反应后，德国几乎免费获得了1万亿欧元（约合1.1万亿美元）的额外资金。【原文：Germany is getting €1 trillion ($1.1 trillion) in additional funding virtually for free after bond markets reacted positively to its “historic” spending bill, Deutsche Bank AG Chairman Alexander Wynaendts said.】

item.title: 特朗普关税转向令外汇交易员削减大波动押注
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布 4 月 2 日贸易清算的最后期限之际，那些押注每天 7.5 万亿美元外汇市场会出现剧烈波动的交易商们正在采取一种新的方法。【原文：Traders who’d bet on sharp swings in the $7.5 trillion-a-day foreign-exchange market surrounding Donald Trump’s last two tariff deadlines are taking a new approach as the president vows an April 2 trade reckoning.】

item.title: 美国待售房屋销量在经历了一月份的风暴袭击后有所回升
item.description: 上个月，美国住宅待售量从历史最低点有所反弹，因为天气转晴，房屋选择增多，为进入关键的春季销售旺季带来了一些乐观情绪。【原文：Pending sales of US homes last month rebounded somewhat from a record low, as calmer weather and a greater selection of houses provided some optimism headed into the critical spring selling season.】

item.title: 欧洲领导人拒绝俄罗斯的制裁要求
item.description: 欧洲领导人联盟拒绝了放松对俄罗斯制裁的可能性，而这是弗拉基米尔-普京总统同意与乌克兰部分停火的要求之一。【原文：A coalition of European leaders rejected the possibility of easing sanctions on Russia, one of President Vladimir Putin’s demands to agree to a partial ceasefire with Ukraine.】

item.title: 南非对战略石油储备 "不足 "表示担忧
item.description: 南非立法者在参观了一个政府所有的原油储存中心后表示，他们担心战略石油库存 "不足"。【原文：South African lawmakers said they’re concerned about “insufficient” strategic oil stockpiles after visiting a government-owned crude-storage hub.】

item.title: 交易者回避长期债务，国债收益率曲线趋缓
item.description: 周四，长期国债收益率达到一个月来的最高水平，因为投资者要求对关税将刺激美国通胀的风险进行补偿。【原文：Long-maturity Treasury yields reached the highest levels in a month Thursday as investors demand compensation for the risk that tariffs will spur US inflation.】

item.title: 法国建议改变欧盟碳市场以提高稳定性
item.description: 法国建议对欧盟碳市场的设计进行微调，以避免价格过高和波动。【原文：France has proposed fine-tuning the design of the European Union’s carbon markets to avoid high prices and volatility.】

item.title: 阿根廷公用事业公司债券反弹面临私有化关键考验
item.description: 在哈维尔-米莱伊总统取消了对公共事业服务的部分价格控制后，国有供水和污水处理公司 Aguas y Saneamientos Argentinos 的债务持有人收获了一笔意外之财，从而引发了这个在严厉监管下挣扎的企业的大幅复苏。【原文：Debt holders of state-owned water and sewage company Aguas y Saneamientos Argentinos are reaping a windfall after President Javier Milei scrapped some price controls for public utility services, sparking a sharp recovery for a business that’s struggled under heavy regulation.】

item.title: BC Partners 将为私人信贷基金筹资 14 亿美元
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，收购公司 BC Partners 旗下的私人信贷部门将为其第三支特殊机会基金筹集约 14 亿美元。【原文：The private credit arm of buyout firm BC Partners is set to raise about $1.4 billion for its third special opportunities fund, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: LVMH 交易后，Moncler 将亚历山大-阿尔诺加入董事会
item.description: Moncler SpA 在去年与法国奢侈品集团 LVMH 达成交易后，将任命该集团亿万富翁、LVMH 创始人 Bernard Arnault 的儿子进入董事会。【原文：Moncler SpA is set to appoint a son of billionaire LVMH founder Bernard Arnault to its board after a deal with the French luxury group last year.】

item.title: 为什么人脑可能推动下一场科技革命？
item.description:
在本期的 Primer节目中，我们将探索生物计算的世界，科学家们正在模糊生物与合成之间的界限。【原文：

On this episode of Primer, we explore the world of biocomputing, where scientists are blurring the lines between the biological and synthetic.

】
